channel.title: Tech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Tech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How YC-backed Bucket Robotics survived its first CES
item.description: Now, the startup is turning its attention to building the business, fundraising and striking commercial deals.

item.title: Moxie Marlinspike has a privacy-conscious alternative to ChatGPT
item.description: Confer is designed to look and feel like ChatGPT or Claude, but your conversations can't be used for training or advertising.

item.title: Sequoia to invest in Anthropic, breaking VC taboo on backing rivals: FT
item.description: Sequoia Capital is reportedly joining a blockbuster funding round for Anthropic, the AI startup behind Claude, according to the Financial Times. It’s ...

item.title: TechCrunch Mobility: ‘Physical AI’ enters the hype machine
item.description: Welcome back to TechCrunch Mobility, your hub for all things “future of transportation.”

item.title: Threads edges out X in daily mobile users, new data shows
item.description: Threads’ daily mobile usage has quietly surpassed X as Meta leans on cross-promotion, creator tools and fast feature rollouts — even as X faces fresh ...

item.title: Italy investigates Activision Blizzard for pushing in-game purchases
item.description: Italy has launched two investigations into Microsoft's Activision Blizzard, alleging the company has engaged in "misleading and aggressive" sales prac...

item.title: Bluesky rolls out cashtags and LIVE badges amid a boost in app installs
item.description: Bluesky adds new features to its app amid a boost in installs due to the deepfake drama on X.

item.title: YouTube relaxes monetization guidelines for some controversial topics
item.description: These controversial topics include self-harm, abortion, suicide, and domestic and sexual abuse.

item.title: Former USDS Leaders Launch Tech Reform Project to Fix What DOGE Broke
item.description: The plan, which is still in its early stages, is spearheaded by former USDS administrator Mikey Dickerson.

item.title: Chinese EVs inch closer to the US as Canada slashes tariffs
item.description: The country is dropping its import tax from 100% to just 6.1%, with an initial annual cap of 49,000 cars.
